content.statement: proc-031-radial-access is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding proc-031-radial-access helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of proc-031-radial-access include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of proc-031-radial-access.

definitions_glossary.allen_test: Test of ulnar artery collateral by compressing both arteries and releasing ulnar
definitions_glossary.spasmolytic_cocktail: Medications (verapamil, nitroglycerin) to prevent radial artery spasm
definitions_glossary.patent_hemostasis: Achieving hemostasis while maintaining antegrade flow (reduces RAO risk)
definitions_glossary.palmar_arch: Arterial arch connecting radial and ulnar arteries in the hand

indications: Carotid artery stenting (via right radial for right carotid, left for left)
Patients at high risk for femoral access complications
Patients who cannot lie flat (respiratory issues, CHF)
contraindications: Severe peripheral arterial disease of upper extremity

preprocedure_assessment.allen_test: Compress both radial and ulnar, release ulnar, hand should pink up within 10 seconds
preprocedure_assessment.plethysmography: More objective assessment of ulnar collateral

positioning.wrist: Hyperextended over towel roll, taped in position

closure.device: TR Band (Terumo) or equivalent radial compression device
closure.technique: Patent hemostasis - maintain plethysmographic signal while compressing

complications.prevention: Spasmolytic cocktail, gentle technique, avoid oversized sheaths
Patent hemostasis, anticoagulation, avoid prolonged compression
complications.management: Usually asymptomatic due to ulnar collateral; observation

complications.prevention: Anterior wall puncture only, proper sheath placement
Gentle wire advancement, use hydrophilic catheters

outcomes.ambulation: Immediate vs 4-6 hours bed rest for femoral

definition.@value: Percutaneous vascular access technique using the radial artery at the wrist for diagnostic and interventional procedures

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Describe the technique of radial artery access
Assess patients for suitability for radial access
Perform radial artery access with micropuncture technique
Manage radial artery spasm and other complications
clinical_pearls: Always do an Allen test before radial access - inadequate ulnar collateral is a contraindication
Patent hemostasis is the key to preventing radial artery occlusion
Spasmolytic cocktail is mandatory - radial spasm is uncomfortable and can trap equipment
Right radial access is easier for right-handed operators and works for most aortic arch anatomy
80% reduction in major bleeding - this is transformative for patient safety

medicalCode.description: Introduction of needle or intracatheter; extremity artery
Introduction of other therapeutic substance into upper artery, percutaneous approach
